TopicTitle: Top Gun AI - The Official Tournament Thread

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> On 2016-01-28 at 8:09 PM, GDJ said:
> 
> 
> Umm....as anybody updated BDArmory to version 0.10 yet? If any of us has, we are going to have to rethink our planes and strategies.   
> 
> The AI is WAY different, enough that the plane's flight characteristics may or may not help us.  
>   
> 
> Off-the-cuff changes I've noticed:  
>   
> 
> -Physics has been extended to 5000 metres  
> 
> -gun range that the AI uses to determine whether or not to fire has a adjustment. Can go from nil to around 8000 metres.  
> 
> -There is a minimum engagement speed, an idle speed, a maximum speed  
> 
> -The Missiles (not pertinent to our tournament) has fire rate adjustments (would help with suicides by slapping into the missiles)
> 

I've been playing around with the new AI and have to say I like it. I've noticed some drastic improvements with the targeting and tracking of enemy combatants

Another thing I noticed is that the AI now utilizes the afterburners on the panther, deciding when to engage afterburners or not ... the AI itself has made some of my planes better although there are a few that don't quite measure up anymore

Eh screw it, here is my 40-ton fighter-bomber

[https://drive.google.com/file/d/0Bz8ksGB7j0xmdU1qdkFFWjBZb0U/view?usp=sharing](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0Bz8ksGB7j0xmdU1qdkFFWjBZb0U/view?usp=sharing)

Equipped with two chin mounted vulcans mounted under the cockpit. If you're going to put my two planes on the same team, and need to remove a vulcan from one of them to make it tournament legal, do so. The inline radar is mounted in the nose. 

The plane may appear to have a very, very slow roll rate when it is first flown by the AI. For some reason, whenever I load this airplane after starting up KSP, it does that. If this occurs, I usually fix it by pressing the buttons that show the CoM and CoL in SPH.

The following of it pictures are slightly outdated (I've removed the missiles and the GAU-8, for example), but give a look as to what the aircraft looks like nonetheless

Spoiler

![8642B7D3FC2793B81288643FF338A4FAA536B602](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/544174641552132142/8642B7D3FC2793B81288643FF338A4FAA536B602/)

After some more testing, I decided upon modifying one of my previous submissions, the CF-59. This variant has been altered to comply with the new rules, and has some other improvements thrown in for good measure. Both planes are identical. 

Plane 1- [https://www.dropbox.com/s/zegopkitbal278u/Zahida%20-%201%20-%20CF-59%20Naga%20II.craft?dl=0&preview=Zahida+-+1+-+CF-59+Naga+II.craft](https://www.dropbox.com/s/zegopkitbal278u/Zahida%20-%201%20-%20CF-59%20Naga%20II.craft?dl=0&preview=Zahida+-+1+-+CF-59+Naga+II.craft)

**Last call for submissions!**
I just realized all my planes are awful because I forgot to use the copy of KSP without FAR. Probably not going to get a submission in, but it's encouraging to know it's not just me.

EDIT: Ok I read the new rules and it completely changed my design philosophy because its guns only. Do you have to submit 2 different planes or can you submit 1 and have it used twice on the same team. so for example if i submitted an F-16 my team would have 2 F-16's or if i submitted and F-16 and F-15 both planes would be on the same team.

> 

Since these crafts never participated in a tournament, as to my knowledge, I'm re-submitting them. The only changes since this post was the engine switch from Whiplashes to Panthers in 1.0.5

Action Groups for all crafts are as follows: Space switches engine modes , RCS is the fire button just in case, 1/2 switches between weapons, 3 is the arming toggle, 4 deploys countermeasures and 0 toggles AI.

As for eligibility in this specific tournament, I'm submitting  the Katana and Shuriken for this one, eligible craft files for these are here:  

[Both only have 2 Vulcan (hidden) cannons, and the missiles have been removed, so they're all set for the tourney.]

[Katana](https://www.dropbox.com/s/cwlv1uk2vq1ooh9/%5B%20Jeremy%20%5D%20-%201-%20%20Katana.craft?dl=0)  
[Shuriken](https://www.dropbox.com/s/7tcx74aedoizhkq/%5B%20Jeremy%20%5D%20-%202%20-%20Shuriken.craft?dl=0)

I read the rules on page 51 but to me the part with the planes felt like a jumbled mess. Thats why i asked for a clearer explanation

I present to you. The Raptor!!

-Combatsmithen-1-Raptor 2 Vulcans-

[http://kerbalx.com/Combatsmithen/Combatsmithen-1-Raptor-2-Vulcans](http://kerbalx.com/Combatsmithen/Combatsmithen-1-Raptor-2-Vulcans)

-Combatsmithen-2-Raptor 1 Vulcan-

[http://kerbalx.com/Combatsmithen/Combatsmithen-1-Raptor-1-Vulcans](http://kerbalx.com/Combatsmithen/Combatsmithen-1-Raptor-1-Vulcans)

Uses radiators as a form of "shielding" this is my first attempt at using them as shielding. Only 45 parts on the 2 vulcan raptor, and 44 on the 1 vulcan raptor.

The raptor is a supermanuverable fighter jet which can maintain control as long as it has thrust.

For some strange reason, the images on the KerbalX page aren't loading so I can't say anything about this one.  I'll edit this post when my computer decides to be a friend again. 

This leaves me in the awkward position of having nine submissions in a tournament for exponents of two, though.  I don't want to cut anyone out, but I can't just inject seven planes into the tournament, either.  This leads me to believe that the submission deadline could do with an extension, especially since it won't slow down production of the tournament at all.  However, I'm afraid this would be unfair to those who have already made their submissions.  **To those who have already made a submission, would it be alright with you if I extended the deadline to the sixteenth?** 

Thank you for your continued patience.
